titles.title: Firearm Child Safety Lock Act of 1998
To require firearms to be manufactured with child safety locks.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 8/6/1998--Introduced. Firearm Child Safety Lock Act of 1998 - Prohibits any person, in or affecting commerce, from manufacturing in the United States a handgun without a child safety lock which, while activated or attached to the firearm, prevents the firearm from being discharged. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to impose a $5,000 civil fine on violators. Provides for judicial review of the Secretary's decision to impose a fine.
